decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling the "UrzaTron" lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate massive amounts of colorless mana quickly. By utilizing powerful colorless threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm opponents with big threats. Cards like All Is Dust and Oblivion Stone help clear the board, while cards like Relic of Progenitus and Walking Ballista provide additional utility. The deck's goal is to establish a dominating board presence and control the game until victory.

The key concept of this deck is to generate powerful creatures through the use of +1/+1 counters and artifacts. The deck aims to quickly build a board state with creatures such as Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker, who benefit from the presence of +1/+1 counters. Cards like Hardened Scales, Animation Module, and Metallic Mimic help to bolster these counters, while artifacts like Welding Jar and Mox Opal provide additional utility and mana acceleration. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful artifact creatures, ultimately leading to victory.

This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently, using Eldrazi Temples and the Urza lands to accelerate mana production. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck includes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to apply pressure early in the game, with support from other Eldrazi creatures like Matter Reshaper and Endbringer. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed, disruption, and powerful threats.

The main concept of this Modern Jund Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, while disrupting their game plan with targeted discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also has removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. To generate card advantage and maintain board control, the deck includes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and enable powerful land interactions with cards like Raging Ravine.

This deck focuses on utilizing the "Dredge" mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard and generate value. The key concept revolves around using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to discard important creatures, such as Gravecrawler and Vengevine, into the graveyard. This enables the deck to bring these creatures back from the graveyard and generate a powerful board presence. Additionally, cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Carrion Feeder provide additional ways to abuse the graveyard, while Leyline of the Void and Assassin's Trophy serve as disruption against opponents.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Wrenn and Six. The deck utilizes powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek help strip the opponent's hand of key cards, while cards like Liliana of the Veil and Vraska, Golgari Queen provide additional disruption and value. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outgrind its opponents in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal damage to the opponent. It includes cheap burn spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Gut Shot to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck also includes card draw like Light Up the Stage and Faithless Looting to maintain a consistent flow of spells. Additionally, the inclusion of Finale of Promise allows for explosive turns, while cards like Bedlam Reveler provide additional card advantage. The deck also runs a disruption package with cards like Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to control the game, with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Whir of Invention to disrupt opponents' strategies. It also features the powerful combo of Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to generate an army of flying tokens. Urza, Lord High Artificer acts as a potent threat and mana ramp engine. The deck aims to control the board, generate card advantage, and eventually establish a dominant position with a combination of spells, artifacts, and powerful planeswalkers.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Thing in the Ice and Arclight Phoenix while using spells like Serum Visions, Faithless Looting, and Thought Scour to quickly cycle through the deck and fill the graveyard. Once enough spells are in the graveyard, cards like Finale of Promise and Aria of Flame can be used to close out the game. Surgical Extraction helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy while Lightning Bolt and other burn spells provide additional reach. The deck is built to be fast, consistent, and able to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard with creatures to enable powerful synergy and recursion effects. By utilizing cards like Bloodghast, Carrion Feeder, and Gravecrawler in combination with cards like Faithless Looting and Satyr Wayfinder, the deck can quickly reanimate creatures like Vengevine and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The inclusion of Leyline of the Void helps disrupt opponent's graveyard strategies, while cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Lotleth Troll help with graveyard filling and manipulation. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and consistent graveyard-based combo strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, and then use your graveyard as a resource to bring powerful creatures like Vengevine and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis back onto the battlefield. This deck focuses on creating a strong board presence by constantly recurring creatures from the graveyard and overwhelming your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Additionally, Leyline of the Void is included to disrupt opposing graveyard strategies and ensure your plan goes off smoothly.

The main concept of this deck is to fill your graveyard with cards, primarily through self-mill effects like Hedron Crab, Stitcher's Supplier, and Satyr Wayfinder. Once your graveyard is stocked, you can reanimate powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, Vengevine, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Combining this graveyard recursion with sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder and Altar of Dementia allows you to create a strong board presence and overwhelm your opponent quickly. Additionally, Faithless Looting helps you dig through your deck and find the pieces you need to execute your game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards that allow players to mill their own decks, enabling them to fill their graveyard with creatures like Narcomoeba, Bloodghast, and Prized Amalgam. This graveyard recursion is further enhanced by cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Creeping Chill. By consistently dredging cards from their graveyard back to their hand, the player can lay the groundwork for explosive combos, such as using Conflagrate to deal massive damage. The deck also includes Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to draw more cards and facilitate dredging.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, and then utilizing cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam that can come back from the graveyard to create a board presence. The key strategy is to utilize cards that allow the player to dredge and mill their deck, while also using cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Creeping Chill to deal damage and quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to help dig through the deck and find key combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to fill the graveyard quickly with cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, allowing you to rapidly reanimate creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine. This leads to powerful combos with cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Carrion Feeder. Altar of Dementia can be used to mill yourself or your opponent, and Blood Crypt, Overgrown Tomb, Watery Grave, and other lands help support the deck's color requirements. The deck focuses on leveraging the graveyard and creature interactions to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard quickly and efficiently, then bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, Vengevine, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. By sacrificing creatures like Carrion Feeder and using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to continuously mill the deck, the player can create a strong board presence early in the game. This combo-oriented strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while maintaining card advantage through graveyard manipulation.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly with cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Vengevine, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The key strategy is to continuously bring back creatures from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful threats and fast aggression. The inclusion of Leyline of the Void helps to disrupt opponent graveyard strategies while Carrion Feeder and Gravecrawler provide additional synergy and value in this graveyard-focused combo deck.

The main concept of this deck is to fill your graveyard with cards by using cards like Faithless Looting, Stitcher's Supplier, and Hedron Crab. This will allow you to quickly reanimate creatures such as Gravecrawler, Bloodghast, and Vengevine while also fueling your graveyard for cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Altar of Dementia can be used to mill yourself and trigger effects from your graveyard, while Carrion Feeder acts as a sacrifice outlet. Lightning Axe provides removal options. The deck is focused on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming your opponent with powerful combo plays.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures to enable powerful combos and bring out key creatures such as Vengevine and Hogaak. The deck utilizes cards like Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier to mill cards into the graveyard, while also having recursion options with Bloodghast and Gravecrawler. The key strategy is to aggressively mill your own deck to gain advantage from creatures entering the battlefield from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

This deck focuses on swarming the board with aggressive Human creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage. By using Aether Vial and the various lands that produce any color of mana, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of high-powered creatures and disruptive spells. The strategy revolves around playing efficient threats and maintaining tempo by disrupting the opponent's plays, all while leveraging the synergy between the Human creature type and various tribal support cards.

The main goal of this Aggro Jund deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck uses efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf to quickly close out the game while controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Maelstrom Pulse. The planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six provide additional value and disruption, allowing the deck to grind out wins against slower opponents. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful artifacts and disruptive spells, with Urza, Lord High Artificer as the centerpiece. Utilizing cards like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to generate a steady stream of tokens while maintaining board control with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ensnaring Bridge. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and Grafdigger's Cage disrupts opponent's graveyard strategies. The deck aims to manipulate the board state in its favor while assembling powerful artifact synergies to outvalue opponents in the long run.

The main objective of this deck is to utilize Urza, Lord High Artificer as the key card to generate mana and create a strong board presence through Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo. Additionally, the deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells like Damping Sphere, removal spells like Pyrite Spellbomb, and artifacts like Ensnaring Bridge. The deck also includes cards like Whir of Invention and Goblin Engineer to tutor for specific artifacts when needed. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, disrupt opponents' strategies, and win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to establish a strong mana base with the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) in order to quickly ramp into powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Oblivion Stone and disruption with cards like Relic of Progenitus, while also utilizing card selection through Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to ensure consistent and powerful plays. It aims to overwhelm opponents with its high mana efficiency and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and counterspells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By playing disruptive spells like Path to Exile and Detention Sphere, along with board wipes like Wrath of God and Supreme Verdict, the deck can take control of the board and protect its powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. With a mix of card draw, removal, and counterspells, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure a win condition.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards. It includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to take over the game. The deck also includes utility spells like Path to Exile and Celestial Colonnade to control the board state. With a mix of card draw, counterspells, and removal spells, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent until victory.
